examples: The painter applied a thick layer of paint on the canvas, creating a textured and opaque surface.
Like cordierite, it’s usually opaque.
And if you notice his eyes are opaque?
This mineral is usually found in metamorphic rocks like gneiss and schist, so is often opaque.
When the Universe was still ionized, prior to recombination, it was opaque.
words.defineEn: not permitting light to pass, thus cannot be seen through
words.defineVi: không cho ánh sáng đi qua nên không thể nhìn xuyên qua

words.defineEn: the visual property of something having a milky brightness and a play of colors from the surface
words.defineVi: thuộc tính trực quan của một thứ gì đó có độ sáng màu trắng đục và cách chơi màu từ bề mặt

words.defineEn: (of cases, statements, etc.) capable of making others believe that something is true with the use of logic and clarity
words.defineVi: (về các trường hợp, tuyên bố, v.v.) có khả năng khiến người khác tin rằng điều gì đó là đúng bằng cách sử dụng logic và sự rõ ràng

words.defineEn: consider carefully and deeply; reflect upon; turn over in one's mind
words.defineVi: cân nhắc kỹ lưỡng, sâu sắc; phản ánh; quay lại trong tâm trí của một người

examples: Just for the record I would like to clarify something my colleague said earlier.
She prepared a delicious lobster dish by frying it in clarified butter until it turned a perfect shade of golden brown.
My grandmother always uses clarified butter to enhance the taste and texture of her homemade cookies.
Clarify that for us from your reporting.
What we saw on the ground clarifies some of the confusion.
words.defineEn: to make something clear and easy to understand by explaining it more
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó rõ ràng và dễ hiểu bằng cách giải thích nó nhiều hơn

words.defineEn: loud and clear
words.defineVi: to và rõ ràng

words.defineEn: impede the movement of (an opponent or a ball)
words.defineVi: cản trở chuyển động của (đối thủ hoặc quả bóng)

words.defineEn: the murder of your own father or mother
words.defineVi: giết cha hoặc mẹ của chính bạn

examples: and that some societies even gave less weight to a person’s parentage 16.
In a nutshell: a preference for ever-smaller penises could have given females greater control over the parentage of their chicks.
And everybody behind the goal goes home casting dispersions about your parentage.
In some traditions, he’s also a son of Odin, but as you’ve probably noticed, it’s not exactly easy to pin down parentage in the Norse world.
words.defineEn: the kinship relation of an offspring to the parents
words.defineVi: quan hệ họ hàng của con cái với bố mẹ

examples: Now, I will preface this by saying that my family and I are opening up a craft brewery in Austin, at the end of the summer.
I have to preface this by saying there's not a one answer fits all for this question.
I want to preface this by saying that all human beings are flawed.
Did they preface what they said with "please give me some feedback and let me know what you think?"
So first of, I wanna preface this by saying that I don't think we should be getting rid of masks altogether.
words.defineEn: an introductory piece written by the author of a book explaining its subject, scope, or aims
words.defineVi: một phần giới thiệu được viết bởi tác giả của một cuốn sách giải thích chủ đề, phạm vi, hoặc mục tiêu của nó

words.defineEn: serving as an introduction or preface
words.defineVi: phục vụ như một lời giới thiệu hoặc lời nói đầu

words.defineEn: awaiting payment
words.defineVi: Đang chờ thanh toán

examples: Jets like the F-22 and F-35 have boom receptacles for receiving the fuel from the boom.
I'm just starring at that receptacle, man.
You actually have to look much closer at the receptacle to see the fruit, which are called achenes.
The flesh of the fruit is actually modified flower petals and sepals, the flower parts that cover a bud leaving the knobby receptacle at the base of the flower.
Its a special kind of plant structure called a fleshy receptacle.
words.defineEn: a container that is used to put or keep things in
words.defineVi: một thùng chứa được sử dụng để đặt hoặc giữ mọi thứ trong

examples: The board of directors of the company was composed entirely of men in gray suits who were resistant to change and innovation, and who were not receptive to new ideas or perspectives.
And they're more receptive to ride-sharing.
And at least in the private markets, investors have been fairly receptive to this model.
Netanyahu was not terribly receptive.
Now most female mammals become sexually receptive when their estrogens peak during ovulation, but it doesn't really work that way for humans.
words.defineEn: ready or willing to receive favorably
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng hoặc sẵn sàng nhận thuận lợi

examples: Bilateral control does the kind of illogical thing of saying.
And they may be mistaken, they may be ill-informed, they may be illogical, but you don't start off with, they're evil.
And presenting both of these views as valid is actually illogical, a false equivalence.
As illogical as these scenarios sound, though, neither one is unpredictable.
But by framing those lessons as illogical anecdotes, they became tests to help practicing monks learn to live with ambiguity and paradox.
words.defineEn: lacking in correct logical relation
words.defineVi: thiếu quan hệ logic chính xác

words.defineEn: having an irritable and unpleasant disposition
words.defineVi: có một khuynh hướng cáu kỉnh và khó chịu

examples: Earning top marks for both piety and general heroic character.
But it’s also possible that Aurangzeb’s bad reputation comes from a contemporary preference for tolerance over piety in our rulers.
The religion structurally avoids hierarchy except perhaps based on piety.

And Gwen's love of the church and her faith wasn't something that was cordoned off in a personal kind of piety kind of situation, but it moved her into the world to make the world a better place, a more truthful place.

As far back as 4000 years ago, Gudea, the ruler of Lagash in Mesopotamia, commissioned a series of statues that served as a kind of stand in for himself, displayed in temples to demonstrate his piety to the gods, as well as his wealth and power to everyone who visited.
words.defineEn: righteousness by virtue of being pious
words.defineVi: sự công bình bởi đức tính ngoan đạo

words.defineEn: deserving or inciting pity
words.defineVi: xứng đáng hoặc kích động thương hại
